fieldsOfStudy: Criminal Justice Administration with a Concentration in Security

educations.schoolName: Basic Military Police One Station Unit Training (OSUT)

headline: Legal Assistant at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), U.S. Department of Homeland Security
summary:
Iâm a Legal Assistant assigned to U.S Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Office of the Principal Legal Advisor (OPLA). I'm responsible for performing a wide variety of support activities for a staff of attorneys involved in Immigration litigation and other law related activities.

As of now, I'm a second year Master of Security Studies (M.S.S.) candidate at Angelo State University's Kay Bailey Hutchison Center for Security Studies.  My areas of focus are intelligence, security studies, and analysis. I will continue to gain more knowledge and experience as I continue to further my career with the Department of Homeland Security. My main objective on LinkedIn is to network with other individuals who are currently working within the Department of Homeland Security, other law enforcement agencies, and the intelligence community.

positions.description: Managed outgoing shipments of correspondence to the Board of Immigration Appeals. Operated word-processing software and computer hardware to produce, store, and retrieve drafts of a variety of documentation types, i.e. reports, memorandum, and letters. Maintained contact with personnel at the Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR) regarding changes to upcoming dockets. Dated stamps, sorted, and screened mail for priority items to ensure timely dissemination and review. Inputted data into a variety of databases and, as directed, gathered data from a variety of databases to provide the most current information related to immigration cases.
positions.title: Legal Assistant/Student Trainee

positions.description: Provided asset protection on two different Duke Energy material/ construction sites housing high value items, products, and research materials. Provided personnel security and property protection at a Duke University student body housing area consisting of 60+ college students. Strictly followed security protocols by independently monitoring different sections of a two man security operated site, and partnered with other security officers to resolve specific site security issues including suspicious activity, and unauthorized site entry.
positions.title: Security Officer

positions.description: Protected two government installations within a foreign country and responded to all site incidents including alarms, breaches, evacuations, and suspicious behavior. Performed routine police work, such as, Mirandize and arrest suspects, settle disputes, diffuse further escalation of conflicts, help intoxicated individuals, and/or obtain factual information at accident scenes. Secured resources and devised means to acquire information pertinent to investigations by interrogating suspects to elicit information, or by interviewing and/or obtaining sworn statements from witnesses/victims regarding an incident.
positions.title: Military Police

positions.description: Provided assistance with packaging, labeling, and loading trucks for shipment to every elementary, middle, high school, and college in the state of South Carolina. Helped train new personnel in the textbook depository on packaging, labeling, and loading or unloading trucks properly. Provided assistance with loading and unloading trucks, and delivering furniture to private businesses, and other government clients for the supervisor of the furniture department on a regular basis.
positions.title: Warehouse Clerk/ Furniture Distributor
